answers.answer: I have gd too. They have me checking my blood 4 times a day. If I can maintain my blood at normal levels then no medicine is needed. They do monitor the baby and do ultrasounds because it can cause your baby to gain weight and theyDont want the baby getting to big. But other than that it's no big deal.
Okay. Thanks. Its just strange because I rarely eat sweets. I exercise and watch what I eat. So idk what happened.
Bump. How will they monitor the baby more?
I took my 1 hour and have to go in next week for my 3 hour one

Its not sweets its carbs in general. If you manage it will diet and exercise you wont need insulin.  They do monitor the baby more often and you will have a greater chance of developing regular diabetes.  I had gd with my first at 20 found out at 22 im diabetic and this pregnancy im on insulin and they monitor really close the babies size.

question: Okay I just got a call from my midwife that I failed my two hr test and I have gd. I know I have gestational diabetes but what happens now. Like what does it mean for my pregnancy because I didn't have this issue with my first.
title: okay can someone with gd or had it please help
